resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: A painting by Jan Stradanus, created for the decoration of the Studiolo of Francesco I de' Medici: a patron of the arts actively engaged in the family's workshops and laboratories. This depiction of the alchemical laboratory is part of several adjacent paintings where Francesco is shown actively supervising or working.
resource.chars: A painting by Jan Stradanus, created for the decoration of the Studiolo of Francesco I de' Medici: a patron of the arts actively engaged in the family's workshops and laboratories. This depiction of the alchemical laboratory is part of several adjacent paintings where Francesco is shown actively supervising or working.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Francesco I de' Medici, represented to emphasize his credentials as a diligent laboratory worker, without claiming the status of alchemical expert. A study of the preparatory drawing for this painting shows that neither he nor Bonsisti were meant to be part of the painting.
resource.chars: Francesco I de' Medici, represented to emphasize his credentials as a diligent laboratory worker, without claiming the status of alchemical expert. A study of the preparatory drawing for this painting shows that neither he nor Bonsisti were meant to be part of the painting.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: A more classical representation of an alchemist's workshop. The activity seems to revolve around this young man holding a vial.
resource.chars: A more classical representation of an alchemist's workshop. The activity seems to revolve around this young man holding a vial.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Likely Sisto de’ Bonsistida Norcia, the court alchemist.
resource.chars:
Likely Sisto de’ Bonsisti
da Norcia, the court alchemist.
